author: Dr Ben Miles
description:
Check out our explainer here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g66x9funPc0

Scientists have developed a one-time gene therapy, AMT-130, that significantly slows the progression of Huntington's disease by targeting and silencing the mutant huntingtin protein in the brain. In a Phase I/II trial, this therapy reduced disease progression by 75% over one year, preserving motor and cognitive functions.

#medicine #breakthrough #huntingtonsdisease #neuroscience #shorts
